EmailTemplate.name: RE: Marketing Solutions for Small Business (1351110090.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: Marketing Solutions for Small Business (1351110090.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Ron, I must admit I am not totally familiar with what you are reference below but I do have a guide on value based pricing that you may find useful: http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/Value-based-Consulting-Rate-Method_FINAL.pdf <http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/Value-based-Consulting-Rate-Method_FINAL.pdf> Best of luck,Sara ___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> If you are in the DC area please check out our upcoming networking event! <http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?oeidk=a07e6cqaqtk0702919f&llr=kp5x6qkab> Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Ronald J. Walker [mailto:ronaldj.walker@yahoo.com <mailto:ronaldj.walker@yahoo.com>] Sent: Tuesday, October 23, 2012 7:00 AM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: Marketing Solutions for Small Business Sara, again, thank you for the information. I need a favor of you. Could you provide me with or refer me to a company which uses a sample format for a consulting contract agreement or service arrangement which shows how you approach a lower price with initial consultation and a graduated arrangement for the increase in a negotiated percentage of payment for any type of services rendered to a client? By utilizing the value-based fee formula? I conduct consulting and liaison services for both instances. Let me explain so you may understand how I approach things. The value based-fee approach may work good in this sense. The formulas may be the following or if I provide a 5-25% percent discount, it may be processed accordingly. Also, because of the term: (floating-fluctuating percentages) of the diversification of the total type of work I do requires me to price or negotiate a whole range of prices for the agreements of services provided or rendered. The reason for the floating-fluctuating percentages is if you visualize a pie chart, the time spent in any given activity could cross over into another work activity. I conduct work in energy & minerals; Indian gaming; Leasing in Commercial,residential and agricultural purposes; processing right-of-ways for many purposes and land acquisition, training sessions etc.., each of these projects is at a different element of criteria to address and process due to the federal compliance requirements involved. Energy & Right-of-ways can be cross-referenced in functionality for example. Energy projects are at the highest end of the cost spectrum of a minimum of $183.00, based upon my estimated 10K gross income for the next year. I've just used 10k for feasible estimation purposes. It could very well be substantially more, if things go according to plan. The 10k projected gross income is a very conservative estimate. For example, if I conduct a preliminary discussion with a client say for a training session on leasing, the initial cost may be for a consultation flat rate of: $100-$110 dollars per hour for the initial discussion and this discussion may proceed to or entail a (4-8) hour session for negotiation purposes. Once a draft agreement is reached on any work project to be performed because of the gross profit margin ratio, my high dollar end per hour cost needs to be established at $183.00 per hour at a minimum. (This cost per hour gross profit margin ratio is at: 10%.) But, I plan to provide a discount to my Native American Tribal clients at the 5-25% ratio initially contingent upon the location and the type of project involved. Needless to say, any projects will need to be discounted at a lower rate or the cost adjusted upward due to the travel cost and the remoteness of the Villages in Alaska. However, Alaska provides for an abundance of work activity potential for what my company performs and plans to due over the next 5 years. The one factor is the inclusion of utilizing other Contract/Consultants in performing the work. What formula is used in factoring these type costs for your training or addressing projects? I hope the scenarios help you to understand what I need to do or what I am asking for. As you know, formulas or projections can be open for subjectivity and interpretation. Should you need clarification, please let me know. Thanks for all your help. Ron. From: Sara Conde <sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>> To: "ronaldj.walker@yahoo.com <mailto:ronaldj.walker@yahoo.com>" <ronaldj.walker@yahoo.com <mailto:ronaldj.walker@yahoo.com>> Sent: Monday, October 22, 2012 10:40 AM Subject: Marketing Solutions for Small BusinessHi Ron, It was so nice speaking with you today. As discussed, here are some marketing resources that may be helpful to you: · Constant Contact - http://www.constantcontact.com/welcome.jsp <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://www.constantcontact.com/welcome.jsp?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCaV5XtEty4bKOI6XmmifgY5mgtLMzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D>· Quick books - http://quickbooks.intuit.com/ <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://quickbooks.intuit.com/?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCaV5XtEty4bKOI6XmmifgY5mgtLMzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D>· Good read on website hosting providers - http://www.pcworld.com/article/249412/which_web_host_do_you_need_six_small_business_plans_compared.html <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://www.pcworld.com/article/249412/which_web_host_do_you_need_six_small_business_plans_compared.html?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCaV5XtEty4bKOI6XmmifgY5mgtLMzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> Best of luck and take care!Sara___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCaV5XtEty4bKOI6XmmifgY5mgtLMzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://www.mbopartners.com/?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCaV5XtEty4bKOI6XmmifgY5mgtLMzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> If you are in the DC area please check out our upcoming networking event! <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?oeidk=a07e6cqaqtk0702919f&llr=kp5x6qkab&mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCaV5XtEty4bKOI6XmmifgY5mgtLMzCvjruKVUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D> Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential.
